result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel A. Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any recommendations.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall attend the next victim impact panel scheduled for October 1, 2015 or at agent's discretion.  Defendant shall complete his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult diploma academy.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: The fine and costs are added to defendant's current payment plan.

The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall begin immediately.    The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Defendant Joel A. Fischer in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Joel A. Fischer in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  No factual corrections on the revocation order.  Statement by Counsel.   Court orders 30 days county jail with huber and good time with sentence credit of 24 days; 13 month revocation of driver's license with credit for any administrative suspension; AODA, IID for 12 months; court ordered the unpaid obligations be reduced to a civil judgment.  - rt

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joel A. Fischer in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Defendant Joel A. Fischer in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of no contest to count 2 - OWI and Count 3 - OAR.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders Count 2 - Withheld sentence; probation two years; $1,379.00 fine; 5 days county jail with huber to begin no later than November 9, 2015; 12 month revocation of DL; AODA; $41.00 blood draw; IID for one year; OWI victim impact panel  complete GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult diploma academy.  Count 3 - straight sentence; court costs; DNA surcharge of $200.00; submit DNA sample immediately after sentencing.  Counts 1 and 4 dismissed and read in.    Count 3 should be added to defendant's current payment plan of $25.00 a month  with payments stayed until defendant is released from custody.  Payments of $25.00 a month to begin 30 days after release from custody.  - rt

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $3,000.00 signature bond with conditions of booking and revocation procedures started on case 15CF29.  Court ordered bond with conditions and recovocation as requested.  Initial appearance set for October 6, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. ba
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Joel A. Fischer in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 11:00 am.  - rt

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel Fischer appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $2,500.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances; and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders a $250.00 cash bond; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court ordered that the clerk begin bond revocation proceedings in Case Nos. 14CF90 and 15CF16. (Clerk determined later that those cases were not Judge Knox-Bauer's cases and informed district attorney.  Will wait for an order from the Judge presiding over those cases.)  - rt
